titleStmt.title: The education of children in learning declared by the dignitie, vtilitie, and method thereof. Meete to be knowne, and practised aswell of parents as schoolmaisters.
titleStmt.author: Kempe, William.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A68296 of text S109252 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 14926). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 133 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 31 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

publicationStmt.pubPlace: Evanston,IL, Notre Dame, IN, St. Louis, MO

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The education of children in learning declared by the dignitie, vtilitie, and method thereof. Meete to be knowne, and practised aswell of parents as schoolmaisters.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Thomas Orwin, for Iohn Porter and Thomas Gubbin,

notesStmt.note: The author's name, William Kempe, appears in Latin verse on A4r and A4v.
Identified as STC 24926 on UMI microfilm reel 385.
Reproductions of a photostat of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery and of the original in the British Library.
Appears at reel 385 (Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy) and at reel 802 (British Library copy).
